title: I just had to dodge my own series because someone picked Blitz mid into Heim
body: Won my first series game. Next game, I get a twitch who in his last 20 games as twitch is 3-17. Now this game.  Our first pick wants to do Fiora mid. Thankfully 2nd pick and I talk him out of this, when their mid pick becomes Heim.I'm third pick and take support. 4th pick starts to grab Blitz. I told him I'm support. So he locks in Blitz mid vs heimerdinger. Had to dodge. It's no fair that I had to throw my own series just to avoid a troll pick. I worked really hard and spent a lot of time to get to series and I get a slap in the face for it. Even more fun, I skipped something else to play today to try to get promoted. Then I get this. This should be reportable and bannable.

replies.body: You insist that you're in the right about dodging, but please explain why. Explain why you turned a probable loss into a guaranteed one. It's shitty that you had a likely troll pick, but if you're in your promos, why wouldn't you take a gamble instead of an automatic failure?

MMR > LP

Dodge = lose lp, lose no mmr
Lose = lose lp, lose mmr, likely get quite angry, waste my time, probably get a report for flaming blitz
MMR = the higher it is, the more lp you gain.

MMR > LP

Yea, because every unconventional pick is losing for sure.

Open minded > Narrow minded.
It's not like I have a 60% Jayce mid winrate or a 53% Heim bot winrate or a 57% Kayle winrate....definitely narrow minded!

In the long run it is. One game won't ruin it at all. It doesn't drop hundreds of feet down into a black hole because of one loss. You being a negative player and probably not trying to push yourself gets you that 300 mmr that you have.

It's not the fact that it's blitz mid. It's blitz mid against heim.

If blitz pulls heim, heim typically dies, due to the fact he has very few turrets with him. That's how. Blitz has a surprisingly large amount of damage with support items. Mid he gets more gold and can buy damage items. Heim is squishy af. Heim will die quickly. I can easily see how heim loses that lane. But you decided to be the douchebag that dodges and takes a guarenteed loss over a chance at losing. There's a few reasons you're where you are at, and this is one of them.
How's blitz going to get all of those items? He won't get the cs, he won't get assists, he's going to have to get kills. Where's that gold going to come from?

Blitz will get the money by csing at tower just like most other people that lane against heimerdinger. You make it sound like trying to lane against a good pusher is just an automatic afk at base or something.

Additionally since he is already at tower it makes jungle ganks especially strong (and Heim doesn't have any escapes) and if he ever lands a hook it is an auto kill.

I am not saying it is a strong match up or anything, but giving up before the game even starts is just such misplay. There are so many things that could have turned that game, or any game, into a win but because you decided it was a lost cause you nipped that potential victory in the bud before it had the change to begin.

I could join the others in arguing why Blitzcrank might have worked, or why you might have won even if he lost his lane, but that's beside the point. At the end of the day, you made the choice to turn what you _thought_ was a loss into a _definite_ loss. Nobody pressed that button other than you. Dodging a promo game equals a loss, you knew that and you decided to dodge anyway. 

Learn to live with the consequences of your actions.

Then, it feels like no matter how many players I'm forced to report, there's almost guaranteed to be more next game.  Player behavior is not improving, it's declining.  Rito's policies are failing.

I have to wonder when I see statements like this what certain people even consider 'trolling'. Is picking a champion that you don't approve of really trolling these days? God forbid someone likes and is good with a champion in a role you are not familiar with. Better report that guy for not picking what is considered good at the pro level even though this is silver.

Btw, if you really do report people that often for such minor things it is likely that the value of your reports has dropped to 0 and they are simply being ignored.

Shaco jungle?  Taric Support?  Yes I'll cringe, yes I'll go in expecting them to perform badly, but I just bite my lip and hope they know how to make best of the situation.

What I referred to are the most extreme cases: Snowman or Disco Nunu; Clarity + Clairvoyance on anyone; Sona; et cetera.  These are all blatant signs of a toxic teammate that is intentionally trying to make you lose and Rito isn't doing anything to fix this.
